description: a(1) = a(2) = 1. For n >=3, a(n) = the a(n-2)th integer, among those positive integers which are missing from the first (m-1) terms of the sequence, below a(n-1) if such a positive integer exists. Otherwise, a(n) = the a(n-2)th integer, among those positive integers which are missing from the first (m-1) terms of the sequence, above a(n-1).
